text: Who is the author of the Epistle to the Colossians?
verseText: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, and Timothy our brother,

text: A primary reason Paul wrote Colossians was to combat false teaching that diminished the supremacy and sufficiency of whom?
verseText: See to it that no one takes you captive by philosophy and empty deceit, according to human tradition, according to the elemental spirits of the world, and not according to Christ. For in him the whole fullness of deity dwells bodily, and you have been filled in him, who is the head of all rule and authority.

text: Colossians 1:15-20 contains a powerful description of Christ's nature and work, calling Him the 'image of the invisible God' and stating that all things were created through Him and for...
verseText: He is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn of all creation. For by him all things were created, in heaven and on earth, visible and invisible, whether thrones or dominions or rulers or authorities—all things were created through him and for him.

text: According to Colossians 1:18, Christ is the head of what?
verseText: And he is the head of the body, the church. He is the beginning, the firstborn from the dead, that in everything he might be preeminent.

text: What does Paul warn the Colossians against in chapter 2, including philosophy, asceticism, and worship of angels?
options: Being taken captive by hollow and deceptive human traditions
verseText: See to it that no one takes you captive by philosophy and empty deceit, according to human tradition, according to the elemental spirits of the world, and not according to Christ... Let no one disqualify you, insisting on asceticism and worship of angels, going on in detail about visions, puffed up without reason by his sensuous mind,

text: Colossians 3:1-2 instructs believers, who have been raised with Christ, to set their minds on things...
options: Above, not on things that are on earth
verseText: If then you have been raised with Christ, seek the things that are above, where Christ is, seated at the right hand of God. Set your minds on things that are above, not on things that are on earth.

text: What virtues does Paul tell the Colossians to 'put on' as God's chosen ones in Colossians 3:12?
options: Compassionate hearts, kindness, humility, meekness, patience
verseText: Put on then, as God's chosen ones, holy and beloved, compassionate hearts, kindness, humility, meekness, and patience,

text: Similar to Ephesians, Colossians 3 includes instructions for household relationships. What is the primary instruction given to children?
verseText: Children, obey your parents in everything, for this pleases the Lord.

text: Who was the primary founder and evangelist of the church in Colossae, mentioned by Paul?
verseText: just as you learned it from Epaphras our beloved fellow servant. He is a faithful minister of Christ on your behalf... Epaphras, who is one of you, a servant of Christ Jesus, greets you, always struggling on your behalf in his prayers...

text: What instruction does Paul give regarding the letter after it has been read by the Colossians?
options: Have it read also in the church of the Laodiceans
verseText: And when this letter has been read among you, have it also read in the church of the Laodiceans; and see that you also read the letter from Laodicea.

text: Who joins Paul in the opening greeting of Colossians?
verseText: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, and Timothy our brother,

text: Paul gives thanks for the Colossians' faith in Christ Jesus and what else, which they have for all the saints?
verseText: since we heard of your faith in Christ Jesus and of the love that you have for all the saints,

text: The Colossians' faith and love spring from the hope laid up for them where?
verseText: because of the hope laid up for you in heaven. Of this you have heard before in the word of the truth, the gospel,

text: Paul prays that the Colossians would be filled with the knowledge of God's will in all what?
verseText: And so, from the day we heard, we have not ceased to pray for you, asking that you may be filled with the knowledge of his will in all spiritual wisdom and understanding,

text: The goal of being filled with the knowledge of God's will is to walk in a manner worthy of the Lord, fully pleasing Him, and doing what?
options: Bearing fruit in every good work and increasing in knowledge
verseText: so as to walk in a manner worthy of the Lord, fully pleasing to him: bearing fruit in every good work and increasing in the knowledge of God;

text: God has delivered believers from the domain of darkness and transferred them to what?
options: The kingdom of his beloved Son
verseText: He has delivered us from the domain of darkness and transferred us to the kingdom of his beloved Son,

text: In Christ, believers have redemption, which specifically involves what?
verseText: in whom we have redemption, the forgiveness of sins.

text: Christ is described as the 'firstborn of all creation'. In context, this emphasizes His role as what?
options: Supreme and preeminent over all creation
verseText: He is the image of the invisible God, the firstborn of all creation. For by him all things were created... He is before all things, and in him all things hold together.

text: All things in heaven and on earth, visible and invisible, including thrones, dominions, rulers, and authorities, were created through whom and for whom?
verseText: For by him all things were created, in heaven and on earth, visible and invisible, whether thrones or dominions or rulers or authorities—all things were created through him and for him.

text: How do all things hold together, according to Colossians 1?
verseText: And he is before all things, and in him all things hold together.

text: Christ is the beginning and the firstborn from the dead so that He might be what in everything?
verseText: He is the beginning, the firstborn from the dead, that in everything he might be preeminent.

text: What dwells bodily in Christ, according to Colossians?
verseText: For in him all the fullness of God was pleased to dwell... For in him the whole fullness of deity dwells bodily,

text: God was pleased to reconcile all things to Himself through Christ, making peace by what means?
verseText: and through him to reconcile to himself all things, whether on earth or in heaven, making peace by the blood of his cross.

text: The Colossians, once alienated and hostile in mind, have now been reconciled in Christ's body of flesh through death in order to be presented how before God?
options: Holy and blameless and above reproach
verseText: And you, who once were alienated and hostile in mind, doing evil deeds, he has now reconciled in his body of flesh by his death, in order to present you holy and blameless and above reproach before him,

text: Paul rejoices in his sufferings for the Colossians, seeing it as filling up what is lacking in Christ's afflictions for the sake of what?
verseText: Now I rejoice in my sufferings for your sake, and in my flesh I am filling up what is lacking in Christ's afflictions for the sake of his body, that is, the church,

text: What is the 'mystery hidden for ages' that Paul was commissioned to reveal, especially to the Gentiles?
options: The date of the end times
Christ in you, the hope of glory
verseText: the mystery hidden for ages and generations but now revealed to his saints. To them God chose to make known how great among the Gentiles are the riches of the glory of this mystery, which is Christ in you, the hope of glory.

text: What is the goal of Paul's proclamation and teaching, warning and instructing everyone?
options: To make them follow Jewish law
To present everyone mature in Christ
verseText: Him we proclaim, warning everyone and teaching everyone with all wisdom, that we may present everyone mature in Christ.

text: Paul mentions struggling with all Christ's energy that works powerfully within him for the Colossians and for those in which nearby city?
verseText: For I want you to know how great a struggle I have for you and for those at Laodicea and for all who have not seen me face to face... For I bear him witness that he has worked hard for you and for those in Laodicea and in Hierapolis.

text: In Christ are hidden all the treasures of what?
verseText: in whom are hidden all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge.

text: Paul warns against plausible arguments used for what purpose?
verseText: I say this in order that no one may delude you with plausible arguments.

text: Believers are filled in Christ, who is the head of what?
verseText: and you have been filled in him, who is the head of all rule and authority.

text: What kind of circumcision have believers received in Christ, not made with hands?
options: A circumcision of the heart (putting off the body of flesh)
verseText: In him also you were circumcised with a circumcision made without hands, by putting off the body of the flesh, by the circumcision of Christ,

text: Having been buried with Christ in baptism, believers were also raised with Him through faith in what?
options: The power of God, who raised Him from the dead
verseText: having been buried with him in baptism, in which you were also raised with him through faith in the powerful working of God, who raised him from the dead.

text: God made believers alive together with Christ, having forgiven all their trespasses and cancelled what?
options: The record of debt that stood against us with its legal demands
verseText: And you, who were dead in your trespasses and the uncircumcision of your flesh, God made alive together with him, having forgiven us all our trespasses, by canceling the record of debt that stood against us with its legal demands. This he set aside, nailing it to the cross.

text: How did God triumph over the rulers and authorities (spiritual powers)?
options: By disarming them and putting them to open shame through the cross
By giving them power over believers
verseText: He disarmed the rulers and authorities and put them to open shame, by triumphing over them in him [or it, the cross].

text: Paul warns against letting anyone pass judgment regarding food, drink, festivals, new moons, or Sabbaths, because these are what?
options: A shadow of things to come; the substance belongs to Christ
verseText: Therefore let no one pass judgment on you in questions of food and drink, or with regard to a festival or a new moon or a Sabbath. These are a shadow of the things to come, but the substance belongs to Christ.

text: The false teachers promoted regulations like 'Do not handle, Do not taste, Do not touch'. Paul says these have an appearance of wisdom but lack value against what?
verseText: If with Christ you died to the elemental spirits of the world, why, as if you were still alive in the world, do you submit to regulations— “Do not handle, Do not taste, Do not touch” ... These have indeed an appearance of wisdom in promoting self-made religion and asceticism and severity to the body, but they are of no value in stopping the indulgence of the flesh.

text: Since believers have died and their life is hidden with Christ in God, what will happen when Christ appears?
options: They will also appear with Him in glory
They will return to earthly life
verseText: For you have died, and your life is hidden with Christ in God. When Christ who is your life appears, then you also will appear with him in glory.

text: What things are believers told to 'put to death' that belong to their earthly nature?
options: Sexual immorality, impurity, passion, evil desire, covetousness
verseText: Put to death therefore what is earthly in you: sexual immorality, impurity, passion, evil desire, and covetousness, which is idolatry.

text: Besides putting off vices, believers should put on the new self, which is being renewed in knowledge according to whose image?
verseText: and have put on the new self, which is being renewed in knowledge after the image of its creator.

text: In the new self, what distinctions are no longer relevant?
options: Greek and Jew, circumcised and uncircumcised, barbarian, Scythian, slave, free
verseText: Here there is not Greek and Jew, circumcised and uncircumcised, barbarian, Scythian, slave, free; but Christ is all, and in all.

text: Above all the virtues believers should put on, what should bind everything together in perfect harmony?
verseText: And above all these put on love, which binds everything together in perfect harmony.

text: What should rule in the hearts of believers, to which they were called in one body?
verseText: And let the peace of Christ rule in your hearts, to which indeed you were called in one body. And be thankful.

text: How should the word of Christ dwell in believers?
verseText: Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly, teaching and admonishing one another in all wisdom, singing psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, with thankfulness in your hearts to God.

text: Whatever believers do, in word or deed, should be done in whose name?
options: The name of the Lord Jesus
verseText: And whatever you do, in word or deed, do everything in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father through him.

text: What specific instruction is given to wives regarding their husbands?
options: Submit to them, as is fitting in the Lord
verseText: Wives, submit to your husbands, as is fitting in the Lord.

text: What specific instruction is given to husbands regarding their wives?
options: Love them and do not be harsh with them
verseText: Husbands, love your wives, and do not be harsh with them.

text: What specific instruction is given to fathers regarding their children?
options: Do not provoke them, lest they become discouraged
verseText: Fathers, do not provoke your children, lest they become discouraged.

text: How are bondservants (slaves) instructed to work for their earthly masters?
options: With sincerity of heart, fearing the Lord
verseText: Bondservants, obey in everything those who are your earthly masters, not by way of eye-service, as people-pleasers, but with sincerity of heart, fearing the Lord. Whatever you do, work heartily, as for the Lord and not for men,

text: Who is the 'beloved and faithful brother' Paul sent to inform the Colossians about his situation and to encourage them?
verseText: Tychicus will tell you all about my activities. He is a beloved brother and faithful minister and fellow servant in the Lord. I have sent him to you for this very purpose, that you may know how we are and that he may encourage your hearts,

text: Who accompanied Tychicus, described as 'one of you' (from Colossae)?
verseText: and with him Onesimus, our faithful and beloved brother, who is one of you. They will tell you of everything that has taken place here.
